  • All Classes
 

All Classes

  • All Classes Interface Summary Class Summary Enum Summary 
    Class Description
    AddressProtocol
    Class which encapsulates the ID address for a specific node.
    BroadcastProtocol
    Algorithm that determines the broadcasting path through the network using the link states of its participants.
    BroadcastProtocolTest  
    ChatApplication
    Class that launches the chat application and connects to the UT simulation server on the reserved frequency.
    ChatMessage
    Class that defined the chat message structure, containing the information about its sender, the message content, and the timestamp of when the message has been delivered in the simple format.
    ChatTextualUI
    Textual UI of the chat application that interacts with the user via the system console.
    Client  
    DataAckPacket
    Packet that is used to acknowledge the corresponding data packet so that the sender can identify whether the current node received a certain part of information or not.
    DataPacket
    Packet that carries a part of information that is addressed to a given destination node.
    DataReceiver
    Class that receives data packets using the sliding window protocol.
    DataReceiverTest  
    DataTransmitter
    Class that transmits data packets to the corresponding receiver nodes using the sliding window protocol.
    IssueAddressPacket
    Encapsulation of addressing response(answer to the ID request from another node) packet data.
    LinkStateProtocol
    Protocol that obtains the information about the network topology through broadcasting the link state updates and observing the neighbors' activity.
    LinkStateRequest
    Packet that is addressed to a certain node and is used to request the link state of a single node in the network.
    LinkStateUpdate
    Packet that is used to update the node's link state and transmit it across the network.
    Message  
    MessageListener
    Class that listens to messages sent by the framework and notifies the node client correspondingly.
    MessageType  
    Messenger
    Interface that determines the means of interaction with the chat application.
    NetworkPacket
    Packet that is used for the communication between the nodes in the network.
    NetworkTopology
    Class that contains the information about the network topology as well as the node's identifier in the network and its neighbors.
    NodeController
    Class that provides a means of communication between the framework and the user in the context of chat application.
    NodeLinkState
    Class used for establishing network topology for each of the nodes.
    NodeState
    Class that determines the states of the node when joining and participating in the network.
    PacketFormat
    Class that determines packet formats used to allocate bytes per fields corresponding to the data these packets contain.
    PacketLogger
    Class that stores packets arriving at the node during its session on the server.
    PacketParser
    Class that parses text into data packets and the other way around.
    PacketSender
    Class that is used to send messages to the nearest nodes in the network.
    PingPongPacket
    Packet that is used to ping the nearest nodes to identify the ones that are located within the transmission range of the current node.
    RequestAddressPacket
    An encapsulation of the ID request packet data.
    SessionConfig  
    SessionProtocol
    Class that handles transmission sessions (either incoming or outgoing).
    SessionUpdate
    Packet that is used to initiate transmission sessions for an arbitrary number of packets for any node in the network (mostly data transmissions).
    VirtualNode
    The interface that determines the interaction between the node and the network (p.s. with the framework)
